definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: He tore a hole in his trousers climbing over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他爬墙时裤子给扯破一个洞。

sentences.english: After you mended your sons' clothes torn by hillside thorns.
sentences.chinese: 你补好了儿子们的为山腰的荆棘扯破的衣服之后。

sentences.english: This sort of cloth doesn't tear easily.
Someone grabbed her pocketbook off her shoulder, ripping her coat open.
sentences.chinese: 有人从她肩上抢走了手提包，还把她的外套扯破。

sentences.english: Do you think it has something to do with what you said about the veil to the underworld possibly being torn?
sentences.chinese: 莫非你认为它和有可能被扯破的亡灵界的结界有关吗？

sentences.english: After you had mended your sons' clothes, torn by thorns on the mountain ridge.
sentences.chinese: 在你补好了儿子们的为山腰的荆棘扯破的衣服之后。

sentences.english: The clothing was deranged, the long hair in disorder, the limbs lay anyhow.
sentences.chinese: 尸体的衣服被扯破了，长头发凌乱不堪，四肢乱摆着。

sentences.english: It is trendy to wear cut-up jeans these days.
sentences.chinese: 最近穿扯破的牛仔裤很符合潮流呢。

definition: to tear up/to tear to pieces
(of sth sharp) to snag (one's stockings etc)
to straighten (by pulling or stretching)/to be even (neither side losing out)
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
